timeline.bodyText: Do you actively maintain that? I'm not really satisfied with the current ActiveMQ images I use and I wanted to have an "Opencast ready" version for some time now. Would be great if that can also be used in production.
timeline.author: mtneug
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+version: '2'
+services:
+  elasticsearch:
+    container_name: opencast-elasticsearch
+    image: docker.io/library/elasticsearch:7.5.1
+    ports:
+      - 127.0.0.1:9200:9200
+      - 127.0.0.1:9300:9300
+    environment:
+      discovery.type: single-node
+  activemq:
+    container_name: opencast-activemq
+    image: quay.io/lkiesow/activemq

replies.bodyText: By discussion in chat: Long term we want to push a well-supported ActiveMQ container to Opencast's quay.io account
replies.author: lkiesow

timeline.message:
Development Runtime Dependency Containers

This patch adds compose scripts making it easy to launch the necessary
runtime dependencies for Opencast development and testing with the
necessary configuration by simply executing something like:

    podman-compose up -d

or

    docker-compose up -d
